definition: over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands

sentences.english: "There were thousands of them, " a villager told a local newspaper.
sentences.chinese: “青蛙的数量成千上万，”某村民向当地报社提到。

sentences.english: The Web has a wealth of information and options.
sentences.chinese: 网络上有成千上万的信息供选择。

sentences.english: Rich in fish, its waters attract thousands of cormorants .
sentences.chinese: 湖中丰富的鱼资源吸引了成千上万的鱼鸟。

sentences.english: The steps had been worn away by the feet of thousands of visitors.
sentences.chinese: 参观的人成千上万，把台阶踩得不像样子了。

sentences.english: Of course there are thousands more stories of heartbreak.
sentences.chinese: 当然还有成千上万令人心碎的故事。

sentences.english: Hundreds were flooded out when the canal burst its bank.
sentences.chinese: 洪水冲破河堤，成千上万的人们背井离乡。

sentences.english: Mt. Tai which is located in Shandong Province attracts thousands of tourists every year.
sentences.chinese: 泰山位于山东省，每年吸引着成千上万的旅游者。

sentences.english: Israel said yesterday that it is calling up thousands of reservists .
sentences.chinese: 以色列昨天声称已经召集了成千上万个后备军。

sentences.english: Thousands of militants traded in guns for stipends and training.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的武装分子开始接受培训并领取安家费。

sentences.english: Thousand and thousand of peopel come to visit the Museum of Qin Terra-Cotta Warriors and Horses every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有成千上万的人来参观泰兵马桶博物馆。

sentences.english: The drought also posed a threat to the immediate future of thousands of smallholder farmers.
sentences.chinese: 干旱还威胁着成千上万小农近期的生计。

sentences.english: Thousands of people lined the processional mute.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的人站在列队行进路线的两旁。

sentences.english: "Reefs that were there for hundreds or thousands of years disappeared in a matter of about a decade, " Kleypas said.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万年形成的珊瑚礁在大约十年之内就消失了。

sentences.english: Outside, thousands of people formed up in long queues, waiting their turn to enter the hall.
sentences.chinese: 外面成千上万的人排长队等候进入大会堂。

sentences.english: But who can describe the thousand means of extinguishing the moccoletto?
sentences.chinese: 但谁能列举出那成千上万种熄灭长生烛的方法呢？

sentences.english: One of the management measures being considered is to cull the herd; there are tens of thousands of them out there.
sentences.chinese: 一种在考虑的措施是精减马群，那有成千上万的马呢。

definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
more than ten/a dozen or more
easily/readily/frequently/at every turn/at the slightest pretext
